meanings.definition: A standard or point of reference against which things may be compared or assessed.
meanings.sent1: Teachers use benchmarks to see how well students are learning.
meanings.sent2: The company set benchmarks to track their progress.
meanings.sent3: The race to the finish line became a benchmark for their speed.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to fitness set a benchmark for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The benchmark for success was reaching the top of the mountain.

meanings.definition: A surveyor's mark cut in a wall, pillar, or building, used as a reference point in measuring altitudes.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor placed benchmarks along the route for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins still had visible benchmarks for elevation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat mistook the benchmark for a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The benchmark on the wall guided the climbers to the peak.
meanings.sent5: The benchmark on the building helped determine its height.
